original_title: Cabinet Nod For Science & Tech University with US Partnership
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Recognizing the need for a skilled workforce to drive innovation and sustainable development, the Sri Lankan government has set its sights on establishing a state-of-the-art University of Science and Technology (UST) in collaboration with a prestigious American university.

The proposal approved by the Cabinet of Ministers, aims to foster a hub for cutting-edge research and development (R&D) while equipping graduates with the expertise to excel in emerging scientific fields and technological advancements.
The Department of Government Information said that the University of Science and Technology will leverage the modern methodologies and global academic networks of its chosen partner university.

Leading contenders include renowned institutions like UC Berkeley, UC Riverside, UC Davis, and the University of Michigan. The final selection will be based on a collaborative, public-private partnership (PPP) model.
